intro: Pisonia buxifolia, commonly known as the boxleaf pisonia, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its dense, leathery foliage that resembles the leaves of boxwood, giving it its common name. Its small, white flowers are clustered in terminal panicles and are often accompanied by bright red bracts. Pisonia buxifolia thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, preferring well-drained soil and full sunlight.
